main event: On November 20, 1963, a UFO sighting was reported in Knoxville, Tennessee, where a single object was observed descending at an altitude of about 2,000 feet.
interesting points: The object was critically evaluated by the D-52 crew, who suggested it might be a meteor., The sighting lasted approximately 45 minutes with clear weather conditions., The investigation concluded that the object was likely a balloon, with a possibility of it being an aircraft., Observations during similar incidents on November 29th drew additional attention to the sightings in the area., Several witnesses, including military personnel, reported their encounters with unknown aerial phenomena leading to the Air Force's documentation effort at that time.
sighted object: a single object descending in the sky
witness description: crew of the D-52 aircraft as well as local civilians
